website_summaries.verdict: For making accurate, almost paper-thin cuts through wood, this pull-style saw is one of the best available, but its blade is delicate.
pros: Great for cross cuts, and tracks accurately thanks to pull, rather than push, action
Super-thin kerf helps make neat flush cuts
Small marking hook is a nice plus
cons: Does not handle ripping well (but most dovetails do not)
Cutting hardwoods can be a challenge for less experienced woodworkers
Handle feels too light for tougher pull cuts

customer_reviews.title: Extremely precise, razor sharp dovetail saw.
customer_reviews.text: This is my go to dovetail saw. It's extremely precise and repeatable. With practice you always get the exact amount of wood removal per cut, so if you need to go say 1/16" deeper it's two more pulls ( it cuts on the pull stroke). The backing keeps the cuts straight, it feels good in the hand...I actually wrap mine with rawhide shoe lace material for a better feel and a larger handle. An absolute joy to use but keep in mind that the kerf is far to thin to get a coping saw into the cut to cut out the waste, it's chisel work. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: D. HarmanTop Contributor: Woodworking

customer_reviews.title: Convenient
customer_reviews.text: Great little saw,arrived on time super sharp, good price I definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Henry S.

customer_reviews.title: Great for shallow cuts
customer_reviews.text: I am not a professional woodworker, but I enjoy the hobby and like the challenge of stretching my imagination. I wanted a thin saw that would work well for some finer cuts but didn't want to spend a lot of money. This seemed like the perfect solution. The blade cuts well and the reinforced top part limits any vibration in the end. In general, I am very pleased with my purchase, but I do wish it were a little taller. The depth of the cut is limited to about an inch. That works well for most projects I've tried, but I had to go back with a thicker saw for a couple cuts I needed to make.
customer_reviews.author: N

customer_reviews.title: Small and light to get into places. Accurate cuts, and easy to use on the pull stroke.
customer_reviews.text: love this little saw. so accurate and easy to use. teeth bite into the wood and make for easy work with fewer strokes. love the size and the handle as well. replaceable blade, but a bit wonky as you have to strike the blade to dislodge it from the spine and handle. i have seen other saws which are easier to replace and use a screw instead of a compression fitting like this one. but still a very nice saw.
customer_reviews.author: JVSGUSCASD

customer_reviews.title: Awesome trim saw
customer_reviews.text: Bought this saw for a baseboard moulding installation and was thrilled at how sharp it came. It's rigid enough to make straight, mitered cuts by hand, and the depth the backer is plenty for most trim thicknesses. The cardboard sleeve it came with has a little snap that lets you re-sheath the saw for transport, which is an added bonus. Nice to be able to buy replacement blades for it if it ever dulls and I don't want to sharpen by hand.
customer_reviews.author: Conor

customer_reviews.title: The Japanese Mini Dozuki Panel Saw is a really nice saw.
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice saw! I was able to easily saw this hurricane panel profile with no fixtures, just holding it in my hand, in just a few minutes. The cuts were easy to keep straight with virtually no burr and no binding at the angle I used the saw to cut. I really liked the starter tip that allows to start a cut in the middle of the material your cutting. The saw blade section is nicly wraped in folded paper and slips into a cardboard sleeve that snaps to hold the cover inplace to protect the blade. Very happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: n.alex

customer_reviews.title: Better than a backsaw
customer_reviews.text: Great little saw. Was hesitant because I bought a cheap harbor freight pull saw that was huge and unwieldy. Also have a bear pull saw that’s decent but flimsy and doesn’t cut 90s well. So looked around for something with the rigidity of a backsaw, but fine tooth like the bear. Takes sum practice. I found you can’t take too aggressive of an angle. More shallow and let it the saw do the work. I’ve cut plywood with it with good results. Would by again.
customer_reviews.author: me1313

customer_reviews.title: Quality Saw for Under $20.00??
customer_reviews.text: For the money, you get a quality, Japanese made saw, which is very precise. People speak of these saws taking forever to cut, but that really depends on how you use this item in your arsenal. I use it for finish cuts, where space and precision matter, and cutting on the pull is a sweet feature for flooring and anything you want a straight cut on.
customer_reviews.author: Victor Hugo

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic saw!
customer_reviews.text: What a great saw! I highly recommend it. Just don't plan on cutting very deep because of the spine. I love the "woodpecker" tooth on the end of the saw that lets you scribe your cut to set the teeth in.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Nice saw. Perfect for guitar frets.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this saw to have a smaller, more controllable version of my larger Dozuki saws. It’s very sharp and makes great cuts. What I didn’t expect and learned tonight is that it is perfect for guitar frets needing a 0.023” slot. I measured several slots with a feeler gauge and maybe it’s a little under but not much. The fret wire went in perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: tom

customer_reviews.title: Well Desiged, Easy to Grip
customer_reviews.text: I am building a boat in my garage. This is my go to saw for all detail work. It effortlessly cuts through wood like a hot knife through butter. This saw becomes an extension of your arm. It is well designed and easy to grip. It is so handy that I also use it in the yard for small trees that began growing along my fence.
customer_reviews.author: Bill K

customer_reviews.title: Nice!
customer_reviews.text: This is possibly my new favorite tool in the shop. Its actually fun to use, I kept finding scrap to saw through! Its well made and well worth the money and shipping wait. Much better than hf and big box store saws. Although its a mini its handy and can tackle many tasks, but its size makes it good for accurate and delicate cuts.
customer_reviews.author: Jaymus

customer_reviews.title: Add is misleading
customer_reviews.text: The add for the saw is misleading. I thought that I would receive one complete saw sand one replacement blade, that is what the picture add for the saw shows. Instead I received just the complete saw and no replacement blade. DISAPPOINTED. Other than that the saw is great and would have gotten 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: BOBK

customer_reviews.title: Not the sharpest
customer_reviews.text: Not super sharp. Not bad for softwoods and softer hardwoods, but for harder hardwoods I had a rather difficult time getting the cut started. I’d say it’s just my skill, but I’ve had sharper saws from other brands (though they were bigger saws). Did I just get a dud??
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Good Japanese quality.
customer_reviews.text: I have been searching for a decently priced Dozuki saw for quite awhile and finally found one that I am completely satisfied with. Well made. The is handle is very comfortable and it cuts with very minimal tearout. For the price, it is a bargain.
customer_reviews.author: Wood Wizard

customer_reviews.title: Crafty Artists. Get this
customer_reviews.text: I am in love with this saw💜 The blade it study but adequately flexible. The saws that I’ve used before would bent easily or a but too big to use at home for small crafts but this saw.... if I somehow break this saw, I’ll get the same one as replacement!
customer_reviews.author: Nana

customer_reviews.title: buy It already
customer_reviews.text: I’m just a crafter not a carpenter but I use this on balsam wood and other soft woods. I imagine it would work nice for small cuts on hard wood like joinery and whatnot. It came in Japanese packaging no English instructions I kinda liked that. I’m going to buy more and give them as gifts.
customer_reviews.author: Jamie

customer_reviews.title: Small saw, excellent quality. CUTS PLYWOOD very well
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this saw. It's a small saw but that makes it very easy to use and get precise cuts with. You don't have to fight with a long, wobbly blade and it rarely catches in the wood grain, even on plywood. I've been cutting through 1/2 inch plywood with it for days now with no problems. I honestly don't think I'll ever really want to buy a bigger saw for any reason since this one does such a great job.
customer_reviews.author: kitty

customer_reviews.title: Precise birdhouse constructor.
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use, cuts straight despite my bad eyesight. The one way cut seems to make it more precise. I done some small craft work with it. Won 1st. Place at the county Fair with a 8 story bird house I built!!
customer_reviews.author: Bocephus

customer_reviews.title: make sure you get the second blade...I didn't
customer_reviews.text: The saw works great but I am pi**ed because I didn't get the replacement blade...so I got half the deal! Worse yet is when I notified the seller about the shortage, I didn't get a response....buyer beware! Amazon...shame on you!
customer_reviews.author: Fred Del Guercio

customer_reviews.title: Amazing
customer_reviews.text: I have been using it for about 3 months now and it is still the first hand saw I grab. It’s very well made. Cuts remarkably straight (something I struggle with other saws) and is still quite sharp. The other saws I own I don’t use because I’m never sure if it will be a straight cut. If this one ever breaks I’ll be sure to buy this same one again! I am not a professional and my skill with tools is limited to DIY projects. Hope that helps!
customer_reviews.author: Esperanto Diver

customer_reviews.title: I like it!
customer_reviews.text: This little saw is perfect for dovetail and other fine cuts where precise control is needed. It is sharp, very well balanced, cuts smoothly, and comes with a handy but, admittedly cheap, little pouch to prevent the teeth impacting other tools in the drawer. I like it!
customer_reviews.author: Wiz

customer_reviews.title: Essential Tool for the workshop
customer_reviews.text: I've had this saw for years and it's incredible how handy it is for making precise cuts. The thin kerf and sharp teeth allow the Dozuki to slice through wood like butter. I broke the first one I had after years of use and re-ordered it immediately. 10/10.
customer_reviews.author: C. Klenner

customer_reviews.title: Cuts very quickly and very straight I am new to Japanese pull style saws so I am still learning.
customer_reviews.text: I am looking forward to becoming proficient with this saw - its easy to see why pull saws are so good at cutting straight
customer_reviews.author: Richard

customer_reviews.title: I like its moderate size so I can use it on smaller projects
customer_reviews.text: Nothing to dislike. It's a good quality tool at a fair price which will last me a long time given that I will use it on a not-everyday basis - maybe a few times a week.
customer_reviews.author: Sue T.

customer_reviews.title: Sometimes pulling works a little better than pushing!
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this saw to use on pine only, lovely to use with nice clean cuts though I did break my rule for this saw and used it on African mahogany ( tsk, tsk ) worked very nice.
customer_reviews.author: adrian j bileydi-lee

customer_reviews.title: Review
customer_reviews.text: It is the best small hand saw that I have ever used in wood working. It cuts easy and and without a lot of effort by me.
customer_reviews.author: Charles Copeland

customer_reviews.title: Surpassed expectations
customer_reviews.text: I was very impressed by how easy and accurate it was to use. I bought it to cut smaller details and it works beautifully.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Troy Hernandez

customer_reviews.title: Love these saws
customer_reviews.text: Love these saws! I also have a larger Dozuki saw, as well as longer crosscut and rip saws without the spine. Absolutely great saws and well worth the money. I find that the blades last quite a while (unless you screw up and bend one...) and they are razor sharp. These four Japanese saws are basically the only hand saws I use and I use them a lot!
customer_reviews.author: aepdx

customer_reviews.title: well-made
customer_reviews.text: This is a precise saw with a very narrow kerf. Great for jobs that require precision.
customer_reviews.author: Craig Cowing

customer_reviews.title: Great value saw
customer_reviews.text: One of my most useful tools, comes in handy in all sorts of unexpected ways. Sharp accurate and fast
customer_reviews.author: Brendan

customer_reviews.title: MAGICAL JAPANESE SAW
customer_reviews.text: Cuts like butter. Smooth & perfect! I used this saw to cut a very delicate part of a Fender Stratocaster fingerboard where I upgraded the plastic nut with a Fender LSR Roller Nut. It's safer than using a router.
customer_reviews.author: ChemistrangE

customer_reviews.title: Great saw
customer_reviews.text: I have bought several saws online for custom wood crafting projects but this one is by far my favorite. I’m pleasantly surprised at the quality of this small saw for the price. Absolutely love it!
customer_reviews.author: Doris G.

customer_reviews.title: Good for a nube to japanese hand tools.
customer_reviews.text: Fast delivery! Blade is good and sturdy for having such a small curf. Will be great for dovetailing. Handle is comfortable but a little cheaply made. Feels like a kids toy. I would say it is worth the price and will do exactly what I need it to but a better handle would have been nice!
customer_reviews.author: Kent J Cogan

customer_reviews.title: Solid saw
customer_reviews.text: This is a solid starter Dozuki. I'm fairly new to woodworking but I have been pleased with the Rockler design. It feels well balanced in my hand and feels rigid pushing and pulling in soft and hardwood. I'll be looking to get a larger Dozuki soon.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great blade. Sturdy
customer_reviews.text: Great blade. Sturdy. Very intricate cuts can be made. The handle has a nice grip. I have only used this on small stock and it gets the job done.
customer_reviews.author: PD4000

customer_reviews.title: love japanese saws
customer_reviews.text: first one i seen like this it can cut through a flat surface with the curved tip
customer_reviews.author: Francis Pitts

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: Be careful! Any twisting motion and your blade bends. Sharp. Fast cutting. Excellent.
customer_reviews.author: czz

customer_reviews.title: Wish I had learned about these Japanese saws earlier, ...
customer_reviews.text: Wish I had learned about these Japanese saws earlier, they cut clean and straight. I'll be adding a few more to my tool collection.
customer_reviews.author: peazley

customer_reviews.title: Very useful
customer_reviews.text: I have already used this mini saw many times. It is perfect for a fast trim or cut, and is very sharp.
customer_reviews.author: william m

customer_reviews.title: Quality saw, glad I bought it.
customer_reviews.text: Although I have not used it too much yet, I really like it. It cuts well and I am sure I'll be using it quite often. Works well for flush cuts, can get real close.
customer_reviews.author: Ron Killian

customer_reviews.title: Great Saw!
customer_reviews.text: This little saw is perfect for dovetails and trim. It cuts through wood like a hot knife through butter almost. After receiving and using it, I bought the other styles of Japanese hand saws as well. Big fan!
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: Good purchase
customer_reviews.text: I prefer Japanese saws over western style - this is a good one.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Lovely detail saw.
customer_reviews.text: This is a lovely little saw. Coming from England I thaught that a good backed gentleman's saw was the best way to cut dovetails by hand. How wrong I was after trying out a Japanese pull saw with its precision gentle cut and ultra thin curf I was hooked. I now have quite a few Japanese saws for different jobs but love this saw for its ability to plunge cut and detail work.
customer_reviews.author: Elena I. Ansdell

customer_reviews.title: Needed for smaller more precise placement with a little more ...
customer_reviews.text: Needed for smaller more precise placement with a little more stiffness in the blade's backbone. Wish I needed it more often.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Howy

customer_reviews.title: but it works great. I am happy to have it in my ...
customer_reviews.text: The saw is cheap, but it works great. I am happy to have it in my tool drawer along with my other wood working tools. Cheap doesn't mean cheap made.
customer_reviews.author: Nolfe

customer_reviews.title: Cuts beautifully.
customer_reviews.text: Just like I bought when I lived in Japan. Wonderful blade and cuts beautifully.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: So far so good, great price
customer_reviews.text: So far so good, cut some dovetails. Cuts a bit slower than my previous saw so I hope it lasts. Cut straight and has a good feel in my hand.
customer_reviews.author: Adam F

customer_reviews.title: Well made
customer_reviews.text: Wound up being not what I needed, but it'll come in handy for other projects. It's clearly well made.
customer_reviews.author: mynxkatTop Contributor: Cooking

customer_reviews.title: so far so good. works as well as you would expect
customer_reviews.text: so far so good. works as well as you would expect, just smaller.

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: Wow cut like a champ! Just love these Japanese saws. Have several in my shop.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent fine cutting hand saw.
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for intricate work leaves a nice finish. Can't go wrong with this one. I have been using it on a daily basis since I got it at work and it has held up great.
customer_reviews.author: INXS 82

customer_reviews.title: Why didn't I find this sooner!!!
customer_reviews.text: JUST WHAT I NEEDED! Lightweight, easy to handle, cuts like a dream! Quickly became my favorite "go to" blade. Definitely plan on more saws from these folks.
customer_reviews.author: Alice Mae Lewis

customer_reviews.title: Great saw...
customer_reviews.text: I love the look, feel, and the way it cuts...you won't go wrong by purchasing this little gem.
customer_reviews.author: Brian W. Ritchey

customer_reviews.title: I now own two.
customer_reviews.text: These saws are excellent at cutting wood.. meaning they cut iit not chop it.

customer_reviews.title: Broke
customer_reviews.text: When I got it it was broke had to use my gas to return it and now I have to wait longer to receive another one

customer_reviews.title: It is great for fine cuts
customer_reviews.text: I've been using these saws for years. It is great for fine cuts. You can cut a slither of wood so thin you can see through it.

customer_reviews.title: Great for a casual wood worker.
customer_reviews.text: Just started trying to make hand cut dovetails. The saw cuts perfectly fine now I just need to work on my skill.

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding
customer_reviews.text: This is an excellent saw—very sharp and rigid, very accurate, and easy to make fine cuts.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: When it is on your hands looks smaller than pictures, but not disappointed at all.
customer_reviews.text: Totally satisfied with this product, it is small but powerful, the finishing of the cut other advantage of this kind of saws.
customer_reviews.author: Phabel Sanchez

customer_reviews.title: For the price excellent
customer_reviews.text: For the price 5 stars all day...its accurate sharp and easy to use...the handle is real wood...but for the price excellent

customer_reviews.title: Most awesome saw I've ever owned
customer_reviews.text: I love this thing. Sharp, compact and easy to use. Can honestly say this is the best saw in the world.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: This was a gift and exactly what they asked for.

customer_reviews.title: Most amazing saw ever
customer_reviews.text: Most amazing saw ever. I am new to woodworking and this was one of my first purchases. I definitely do not regret it. Great for smaller projects.
customer_reviews.author: E Chaney

customer_reviews.title: Its easy to
customer_reviews.text: The small panel saw is just right for some of the smaller projects I deal with. Its easy to use

customer_reviews.title: Great quality
customer_reviews.text: For a small inexpensive Dozuki it is sharp and very well made.

customer_reviews.title: Great small saw.
customer_reviews.text: For the money you can't go wrong if you need a smaller, fine-tooth saw. Truly a pleasure to use.

customer_reviews.title: You won't be disappointed!
customer_reviews.text: Great saw. Absolutely love it and use it all the time.

customer_reviews.text: very good Japanese blade!!!!! cuts with minimal force, great for detailed work, leaves a great finish

customer_reviews.title: Lovely detail saw.
customer_reviews.text: Someone gave my husband one of these years ago and he has practically worn it to a shred, he loves it that much. So happy to find a new one for him!

customer_reviews.title: Two Stars
customer_reviews.text: Inexpensive. Bent first time i cut with it. Got what i paid for.

customer_reviews.text: OMG, I love the cut on these saws. The best cutting hand saw on the market.

customer_reviews.text: My second of this type. I could take a finger off with it!

customer_reviews.title: Love it!!
customer_reviews.text: Used it yesterday and it's awesome!!! Cut was quick and the blade just felt like butter.

customer_reviews.title: Amateur making professional quality cuts
customer_reviews.text: Just as described and cuts are quick and smooth. I got a little too confident and bent the blade on a dovetail, but still cuts amazing.
customer_reviews.author: Art Zarate Jr.

customer_reviews.title: Good saw
customer_reviews.text: I'm new to hand cut joinery. The saw blade is surprisingly thin which is makes for an easy cut. The saw is comfortable, easy to handle, and makes very straight cuts.

customer_reviews.title: This is like 6 more
customer_reviews.text: Harbor freight pull saw is $10. This is like 6 more. Worth the difference.

customer_reviews.text: It’s a nice little saw to make flush cuts and to get into tight places...

customer_reviews.text: Great little saw. I used it all the time. Cuts well.

customer_reviews.text: Very nice little saw. Cuts as well as my Silkies and an extremely affordable piece for your kit.

customer_reviews.text: Fine quality saw. Used it for 3 months to cut plywood and the saw still retains sharpness, cuts are smooth and clean
customer_reviews.author: Andre C

customer_reviews.title: Quality economy dovetail saw!
customer_reviews.text: This was my first dovetail saw... and I couldn't be happier. It feels good in the hand. It looks and feels of good quality. The teeth are quite aggressive... more so than what I was expecting, but I got used to it pretty quickly and was able to pump out hand cut dovetails in no time at all. Considering the price and the quality, I don't think I'd ever really considering getting a different one!
customer_reviews.author: Ronald E. Mahler

customer_reviews.title: as i imagine
customer_reviews.text: perfect, well package, does its job wonderfully, great grip on handle,very precise cut, very light and durable. Highly recommending it.

customer_reviews.text: Very well made and extremely sharp. Firm enough to cut a straight line.
